docs.lead_paragraph: Union members banged thundersticks inside a hall festooned with a Hillary Clinton mural as she strode to the stage. The recent rally was one of a series of union events the Clinton campaign staged to show off its backing from the labor movement, a pivotal player in the next state to vote in the Democratic presidential contest.

headline.main: Labor Divides Over Democratic Presidential Contest
headline.print_headline: Labor Divides Over Democratic Presidential Contest

docs.snippet: Union members banged thundersticks inside a hall festooned with a Hillary Clinton mural as she strode to the stage. The recent rally was one of a series of union events the Clinton campaign staged to show off its backing from the labor movement, a...

headline.main: Donald Trump and Jeb Bush Lighten Up at South Carolina Event

docs.abstract: Donald J. Trump appeared to soften his tone in his fight with Pope Francis, and Jeb Bush also revealed a lighter side, during a town hall forum hosted by CNN on Thursday.
docs.snippet: Donald J. Trump appeared to soften his tone in his fight with Pope Francis, and Jeb Bush also revealed a lighter side, during a town hall forum hosted by CNN on Thursday.

byline.original: By MAGGIE HABERMAN and ASHLEY PARKER

docs.lead_paragraph: Residents of the Porter Ranch community in Los Angeles say they worry that health problems will continue from the natural gas leak that was discovered in October.

headline.main: A Gas Leak Is Capped, but Neighbors Are Wary
headline.print_headline: A Gas Leak Is Capped, but Neighbors Are Wary

docs.abstract: California officials announce they have permanently capped leaking natural gas well near Porter Ranch neighborhood in Los Angeles that spewed thousands of tons of methane into air over four month period; residents say despite reassurances from Southern California Gas utility, they are still  becoming ill and many have said they will not move back.
docs.snippet: Residents of the Porter Ranch community in Los Angeles say they worry that health problems will continue from the natural gas leak that was discovered in October.

docs.lead_paragraph: The agency also called for access to emergency contraception and pregnancy counseling, potentially opening a conflict with the Roman Catholic Church.

headline.main: W.H.O. Recommends Contraception in Countries With Zika Virus
headline.print_headline: W.H.O. Urges Contraception in Countries With Virus

docs.abstract: World Health Organization issues controversial guideline promoting contraceptive use in Latin American countries plagued by Zika virus; recommendations could potentially trigger conflict with Roman Catholic Church.
docs.snippet: The agency also called for access to emergency contraception and pregnancy counseling, potentially opening a conflict with the Roman Catholic Church.

byline.contributor: Sewell Chan contributed reporting from London, and Simon Romero from São Paulo, Brazil.

docs.lead_paragraph: People in the trenches of policy making are unhappy with being criticized as corporate tools and with what they view as wishful thinking.

headline.main: Why Left-of-Center Wonks Are Skeptical of Bernie Sanders

docs.snippet: People in the trenches of policy making are unhappy with being criticized as corporate tools and with what they view as wishful thinking.

docs.lead_paragraph: The hackers had deployed a malware attack to hold the computer system of Hollywood Presbyterian Medical Center hostage and demanded the ransom.

headline.main: Los Angeles Hospital Pays Hackers $17,000 After Attack
headline.print_headline: A Web Crime on the Rise:  Hackers Lock Out Users and Demand a Ransom

docs.abstract: Cyberhackers, in shift, are moving away from small users to larger entities, like hospitals, where they are taking control of critical computer systems through malware and demanding ransoms for their release; Hollywood Presbyterian Medical Center in Los Angeles, which paid $17,000 ransom to release hacked and locked computers, is not first victim of its type, but is among first to make incident public.
docs.snippet: The hackers had deployed a malware attack to hold the computer system of Hollywood Presbyterian Medical Center hostage and demanded the ransom.

byline.original: By STACY COWLEY and LIAM STACK

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court in Atlanta on Thursday upheld a contraceptive mandate included in the president's health care law but is delaying the implementation of its ruling until the U.S. Supreme Court can weigh in on the issue.

headline.main: Appeals Court Upholds Health Care Law Contraceptive Mandate
headline.print_headline: Appeals Court Upholds Health Care Law Contraceptive Mandate

docs.snippet: A federal appeals court in Atlanta on Thursday upheld a contraceptive mandate included in the president's health care law but is delaying the implementation of its ruling until the U.S. Supreme Court can weigh in on the issue.

docs.lead_paragraph: A Russian government plan to shore up the recession-battered economy will cost around 880 billion roubles ($11.7 billion), Economy Minister Alexei Ulyukayev told a cabinet meeting on Thursday.

headline.main: Plan to Revive Russian Economy to Cost $11.7 Billion - Economy Minister
headline.print_headline: Plan to Revive Russian Economy to Cost $11.7 Billion - Economy Minister

docs.snippet: A Russian government plan to shore up the recession-battered economy will cost around 880 billion roubles ($11.7 billion), Economy Minister Alexei Ulyukayev told a cabinet meeting on Thursday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Intermountain Healthcare is trying to keep rate increases in line with increases in consumer prices.

headline.main: A Novel Plan for Health Care: Cutting Costs, Not Raising Them

docs.abstract: Intermountain Healthcare, nonprofit health system in Salt Lake City, is attempting unheard-of guarantee to keep annual rate increases to one-third to one-half less than what many employers face by sharply cutting costs rather then passing them on; group, which operates 22 hospitals and employs 1,400 doctors, projects savings of $2 billion over five years.
docs.snippet: Intermountain Healthcare is trying to keep rate increases in line with increases in consumer prices.
